meanings.definition: To sever the connection or link between two things.
meanings.sent1: She was disconnecting the old phone from the charger.
meanings.sent2: I am disconnecting the cable from the TV.
meanings.sent3: The cat was disconnecting the yarn from the knitting needles.
meanings.sent4: The storm was disconnecting the power lines, leaving the town in darkness.
meanings.sent5: The surgeon was disconnecting the damaged nerve to prevent further pain.

meanings.definition: To break off communication or contact with someone.
meanings.sent1: He is disconnecting from his old friends to focus on his studies.
meanings.sent2: She decided to disconnect from social media for a while.
meanings.sent3: The robot was disconnecting from its control panel, causing chaos in the lab.
meanings.sent4: The astronaut was disconnecting from mission control as they drifted further into space.
meanings.sent5: The detective was disconnecting from his informant to protect their identity.

meanings.definition: To disengage or detach oneself from a situation or relationship.
meanings.sent1: She is disconnecting from the toxic relationship for her own well-being.
meanings.sent2: He is disconnecting from the stressful work environment to find peace.
meanings.sent3: The student was disconnecting from the noisy classroom by putting on headphones.
meanings.sent4: The hiker was disconnecting from the daily routine by exploring the wilderness.
meanings.sent5: The artist was disconnecting from reality to immerse in the world of imagination.
